CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 19, 1967, pg. 1, reads: "Examining 20 lb Sledge - UNPC Vice Chairman Charles Harris examines 20 - pound sledge left by county detectives who allegedly used it to smash door to Miss Dorothy Sandidge's home on Avalon St., Friday night after she was awakened from sleep by three county detectives at front door. Detectives forgot sledge and left it behind when they arrested Miss Sandidge."
TitMainTitle: Charles Harris holding sledgehammer, in front of door destroyed by police detectives, at home of Dorothy Sandidge, 3146 Avalon Street, Schenley Heights
